    Current Projects

    • CONTRIBUTE

      The Missing Maps project aims to map the most vulnerable places in the world (affected by humanitarian crises. disease epidemics, conflict, natural disasters, poverty, environmental crises). Building on HOT's disaster preparedness projects, the Missing Maps tasks facilitate preemptive mapping of... read more.

    • CONTRIBUTE

      The region of Bangassou was affected by violence in March 2013. In order to allow access to secondary health care in the region of Bangassou, MSF has started supporting HRUB (Hopital Régional Universitaire de Bangassou) since February 2014. From early... read more.

      The Missing Maps project aims to map the most vulnerable places in the world (affected by humanitarian crises. disease epidemics, conflict, natural disasters, poverty, environmental crises).     • CONTRIBUTE

      The Democratic Republisc of Congo is a priority country for the Missing Maps project. South Kivu is a province of DRC that, for decades, has faced unceasing humanitarian crises. With constantly changing conflicts, seasonal disease epidemics and a population in... read more.

    • CONTRIBUTE

      The Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) is a high priority country for the Missing Maps project. For decades, eastern DRC, where South Kivu is situated, has experienced armed conflict, political instability, and serious health crises. Armed militias loot and attack... read more.

    • CONTRIBUTE

      Bukama and its region have been partially mapped, but there is relatively little data on surrounding rural settlements and their connecting roads. In order to support an upcoming MSF measles vaccination programme, we need to fill in the gaps by... read more.
